body.p: When different speakers speak in the drama at the same time, at which the wording of their speeches is different, these "common speech acts" are enclosed by <spGrp>.
The simultaneity is often indicated by a bracketing between the speech acts concerned, which is encoded using the attribute value pair @rendition="#leftBraced | #rightBraced" in the <spGrp> element.

example.title: Encoding of Common Speech Acts with Bracketing

fig.codeblock:
Zobea und die Weiber.

Weh mein ihr Vater meine ihre Brüder! Wildes Feuer, Ströme Blut!

Sinabal.

Senget, brennet alles nieder, Mordet der Verräther Brut!

p.i: Source: Robert, Ludwig: Die Sylphen. Berlin, 1806. [Facsimile 103]

body.note: For the encoding of bracketings cf. chap. Bracketings.
